mainBoard.name: Brothers Yamazaki
mainBoard.originalText:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
If there are exactly two permanents named Brothers Yamazaki on the battlefield, the "legend rule" doesn't apply to them.
Each other creature named Brothers Yamazaki gets +2/+2 and has haste.

rulings.text: The two Brothers could be controlled by different players.
There are two versions of this card, each with different art. The cards are numbered 160a/306 and 160b/306. The art has no effect on game play.

If a third Brothers Yamazaki enters the battlefield, the legend rule will apply. If one player controls more than one Brothers Yamazaki at that time, that player will have to choose one and put the rest into their graveyard.

mainBoard.name: Mogg Flunkies
mainBoard.originalText: Mogg Flunkies can't attack or block alone.

rulings.text: Although Mogg Flunkies can't attack alone, other attacking creatures don't have to attack the same player, planeswalker, or battle. For example, Mogg Flunkies could attack an opponent and another creature could attack a planeswalker that opponent controls. Similarly, other blocking creatures don't have to block the same creature that Mogg Flunkies blocks.
If an effect says that Mogg Flunkies attacks or blocks if able and you control another creature able to attack or block, you must attack or block with Mogg Flunkies and that creature.
If you control more than one Mogg Flunkies, they can attack or block together, even if no other creatures attack or block.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, Mogg Flunkies can attack or block with a creature controlled by your teammate, even if no other creatures you control are attacking or blocking.
Once Mogg Flunkies has attacked or blocked, it will remain in combat even if you no longer control another attacking or blocking creature.

mainBoard.text: This creature can't attack or block alone.

mainBoard.name: Pigment Storm
mainBoard.originalText: Pigment Storm deals 5 damage to target creature. Excess damage is dealt to that creature's controller instead.

rulings.text: Excess damage has been dealt to a creature if the damage dealt to it is greater than lethal damage. Usually, this means damage greater than its toughness, although damage already marked on the creature is taken into account.
If the target creature is an illegal target by the time Pigment Storm tries to resolve, the spell won't resolve. It won't deal damage to any player.

Pigment Storm's replacement effect is a self-replacement effect. It is applied before any other replacement effects that would change the amount of damage dealt to the target creature and its controller.

mainBoard.text: Pigment Storm deals 5 damage to target creature. Excess damage is dealt to that creature's controller instead.

mainBoard.name: Twinferno
mainBoard.originalText:
Choose one —
• When you cast your next instant or sorcery spell this turn, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
• Target creature you control gains double strike until end of turn. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

rulings.text: If the spell that's copied has damage divided as it was cast, the division can't be changed (although the targets receiving that damage still can). The same is true of spells that distribute counters.

If the spell that's copied is modal (that is, it says "Choose one —" or the like), the copy created by Twinferno's delayed triggered ability will have the same mode or modes. You can't choose different ones.
The copies that Twinferno's ability creates are created on the stack, so they're not "cast." Abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell won't trigger.

You can't choose to pay any additional costs for the copy created by Twinferno's delayed triggered ability. However, effects based on any additional costs that were paid for the original spell are copied as though those same costs were paid for the copy too.

foreignData.flavorText: Au fil des éons, la pierre s'est érodée, révélant les couleurs vives du cœur de la montagne.
foreignData.name: Promontoire prospère
foreignData.text:
Le Promontoire prospère arrive engagé. Au moment où il arrive, choisissez une couleur autre que le rouge.
{T} : Ajoutez {R} ou un mana de la couleur choisie.

foreignData.flavorText: Col passare delle ere, la pietra si erose, rivelando i brillanti colori nel cuore della montagna.
foreignData.name: Falesia Florida
foreignData.text:
La Falesia Florida entra TAPpata. Mentre entra, scegli un colore diverso dal rosso.
{T}: Aggiungi {R} o un mana del colore scelto.

foreignData.flavorText: 悠久の時を経て岩肌は削られ、山の中心の豊かな色彩が露わになった。
foreignData.name: 興隆する絶壁
foreignData.text:
興隆する絶壁はタップ状態で戦場に出る。これが戦場に出るに際し、赤でない色１色を選ぶ。
{T}：{R}か、その選ばれた色のマナ１点を加える。

mainBoard.name: Thriving Bluff
mainBoard.originalText:
Thriving Bluff enters tapped. As it enters, choose a color other than red.
{T}: Add {R} or one mana of the chosen color.
mainBoard.text:
This land enters tapped. As it enters, choose a color other than red.
{T}: Add {R} or one mana of the chosen color.
